gameDescription: In Operation Pollination, players commandeer advanced airships in a near future where the survival of bees and the global ecosystem is at stake. The game combines strategic decision-making with environmental conservation, focusing on the crucial role bees play in our world.

setting.missionEnd: Various global destinations impacted by environmental crises

blueTeam.name: The Bombus Navigators
blueTeam.description: Esteemed for their advanced navigation skills and expertise in creating safe and sustainable bee habitats.

redTeam.name: The Apis Aviators
redTeam.description: Renowned for their deft airship piloting abilities and innovative methods of restoring bee populations.

turns.scenario: Post-hurricane recovery is daunting. Both teams must decide whether to plant native flowers or establish new bee colonies in safe zones.

options.A: Plant native flowers in hurricane-affected areas.
options.B: Establish new bee colonies in safe zones.

AA.narrative: Both teams work tirelessly planting native flowers in affected areas. Their efforts are rewarded as they see a boost in bee populations, but the task consumes a substantial amount of their resources.

AB.narrative: One team focuses on planting flowers while the other establishes new colonies. Their combined efforts result in a rejuvenated ecosystem, blending vibrancy with security for the bees.

BA.narrative: While one team contributes with flowers, the other works on safe colonies. This diversified approach aids recovery efforts, giving affected areas a promising start for revival.

BB.narrative: Both teams opt to establish safe colonies. Respecting nature’s resilience, they provide secure homes for relocated bees. Their joint efforts build a hopeful future, ensuring the survival of crucial pollinators.

turns.scenario: Wildfire restoration is critical. Should the teams seed bee-friendly vegetation in ravaged areas or create artificial habitats?

options.A: Seed fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly vegetation.
options.B: Create artificial bee habitats in unaffected regions.

AA.narrative: Seeding the ravaged areas, both teams foster the birth of new ecosystems. While their actions utilize significant resources, they lay the groundwork for a diverse, flourishing habitat.

AB.narrative: While one team seeds new vegetation, the other establishes artificial habitats. Both are successful in their efforts, creating a blend of natural and man-made homes for the bees.

BA.narrative: One team busily seeds new vegetation as the other builds artificial habitats. This dual approach allows for several fallbacks if one method fails, creating a safety net for the local bee population.

BB.narrative: By choosing to create artificial habitats, both teams put technology to effective use. This ensures the bee population does not depend entirely on natural factors, paving the way for a hopeful future.

turns.scenario: Sustainable expansion is the final and ongoing mission while deciding between developing bee sanctuaries or launching educational campaigns.

options.A: Develop bee sanctuaries with advanced ecological technology.
options.B: Launch educational campaigns to promote bee conservation.

AA.narrative: Both teams invest in advanced sanctuaries. Their ground-breaking work acts as a beacon for global bee conservation, emphasizing that human intervention can indeed be beneficial with the right intentions.

AB.narrative: With one team crafting sanctuaries and the other spearheading education, their combined impact is significant. The fusion of technology and knowledge cultivates an increased respect for our tiny winged allies.

BA.narrative: One team delivers an education campaign as the other builds sanctuaries, promoting a well-rounded approach to conservation. Their efforts resonate globally, encouraging increased participation in conservation efforts.

BB.narrative: Both teams opt for educational campaigns. Their collective influence promotes understanding and opens people’s eyes to the vital role of bees, paving the way for a sustained global conservation effort.
